===Etymology 1===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
{{wikipedia|Thunder}}
{{wikipedia|Lightning}}
[[File:Lightning over Oradea Romania 3.jpg|thumb|right|250px|{{lang|ja|雷}} (''kaminari'', ''kannari'', ''ikazuchi'', ''narukami'', ''rai''): '''[[thunder]]''' and '''[[lightning]]'''.]]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かみなり}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=かみなり|神|tr1=kami|t1=god, spirit|鳴り|tr2=nari|t2=the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|鳴る}} ''naru'', “to cry out, to call”}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|かみなり|acc=3|acc_ref=NHK,DJR|acc2=4|acc2_ref=NHK,DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かみなり}}

# [[thunder]] {{qualifier|the sound}}
# [[lightning]], a [[thunderbolt]]

=====Usage notes=====
This ''kaminari'' reading is the most common reading when used as a standalone noun.

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|thunder}}: {{ja-r|雷鳴|らいめい}}
* {{sense|lightning}}: {{ja-r|電|いなずま}}, {{ja-r|稲妻|いなずま}}, {{ja-r|稲光|いなびかり}}, {{ja-r|落雷|らくらい}}
* {{sense|both}} {{ja-r|雷電|らいでん}}: [[thunder]] and [[lightning]]

=====Idioms=====
* {{ja-r|雷が落ちる|かみなり が おちる}}: “the thunder comes down” → to be [[scolded]] severely by a superior, to be [[ripped]] a new one

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かんなり}}
{{IPAchar|/kaminari/}} → {{IPAchar|/kannari/}}

Shift in pronunciation from ''kaminari'' above.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|かんなり}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|雷鳴り}}, {{ja-l|雷鳴}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|かんなり}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=かんなり|rare|archaic}} [[thunder]] {{qualifier|the sound}}
# {{lb|ja|sort=かんなり|rare|archaic}} [[lightning]], a [[thunderbolt]]

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|かんなり}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=かんなり|rare|archaic}} short for {{m|ja|雷の壺|tr=Kaminari no Tsubo|lit=thunder pot}}, one of the five buildings in the imperial palace in ancient {{m|ja|平安京|tr=Heian Kyō||[[w:Heian-kyō|Heian-kyō]]|pos=modern-day [[w:Kyoto|Kyōto]]}}

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|いかずち}}
{{IPAchar|/ika t͡su t͡ɕi/}} → {{IPAchar|/ikad͡ʑut͡ɕi/}} → {{IPAchar|/ikazut͡ɕi/}}

From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=いかずち}}. Originally a compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=いかずち|厳|tr1=ika|t1=sternness, terribleness, imposingness|つ|tr2=tsu|pos2={{etyl|ojp|-}} possessive particle|霊|tr3=chi|t3=spirit, force, essence}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|いかずち}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|いかずち|hhira=いかづち}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=いかずち|rare|archaic}} something [[ferocious]] and [[imposing]], a [[demon]] or [[devil]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=いかずち|rare|archaic}} [[thunder]] {{qualifier|the sound}}
# {{lb|ja|sort=いかずち|rare|archaic}} [[lightning]], a [[thunderbolt]]

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|なるかみ}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=なるかみ|鳴る|tr1=naru|t1=to cry out, to call|神|tr2=kami|t2=god, spirit}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|なるかみ}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|鳴る神}}, {{ja-l|鳴神}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|なるかみ}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=なるかみ|rare}} [[thunder]] {{qualifier|the sound}}
# {{lb|ja|sort=なるかみ|rare}} [[lightning]], a [[thunderbolt]]

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper|なるかみ}}

# one of the eighteen styles of [[kabuki]]
#: This sense is more commonly spelled as {{ja-l|鳴神}}.

===Etymology 5===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|らい}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=らい}} {{m|zh|雷|tr=luəi||thunder}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} reading '' léi'', {{etyl|yue|-}} ''leoi<sup>4</sup>''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|らい|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|らい}}

# {{lb|ja|sort=らい|rare}} [[thunder]] {{qualifier|the sound}}
# {{lb|ja|sort=らい|rare}} [[lightning]], a [[thunderbolt]]

=====Usage notes=====
Used more in compounds than on its own. As a standalone noun, the ''kaminari'' reading is the most common.
